member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS
member.summary: TheMIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS structure stores the statistics that are associated with an outgoing multicast interface.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.dwOutIfIndex
member.summary: Specifies the outgoing interface to which these statistics are related.

summary.para: Specifies the address of the next hop that corresponds to dwOutIfIndex. The dwOutIfIndex and dwIfNextHopIPAddr members uniquely identify a next hop on point-to-multipoint interfaces, where one interface connects to multiple networks. Examples of point-to-multipoint interfaces include non-broadcast multiple-access (NBMA) interfaces, and the internal interface on which all dial-up clients connect.
For Ethernet and other broadcast interfaces, specify zero. Also specify zero for point-to-point interfaces, which are identified by only dwOutIfIndex.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.ulTtlTooLow
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets on this outgoing interface that were discarded because the packet's time-to-live (TTL) value was too low.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.ulFragNeeded
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets that required fragmentation when they were forwarded on this interface.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.ulOutPackets
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets that were forwarded out this interface.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.ulOutDiscards
member.summary: Specifies the number of packets that were discarded on this interface.

The dwOutIfIndex and dwIfNextHopIPAddr members uniquely identify a next hop on point-to-multipoint interfaces, where one interface connects to multiple networks. Examples of point-to-multipoint interfaces include non-broadcast multiple-access (NBMA) interfaces, and the internal interface on which all dial-up clients connect.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.pvDialContext
member.summary: Reserved. This member should be NULL.

member.name: MIB_IPMCAST_OIF_STATS.ulTtlTooLow
